Description: Fragment (three sherds joined) of shoulder of Clazomenian black-figure painted pottery hydria (Urla Group). Shoulder, parts of four cocks. Belly, tops of a head to right, of a male head to right, of a female head to left, of a curved wing (?). Purple on necking ring, on comb and ruff of cocks, on hair of male head. White for dots at base of wing and of tail feathers of cocks, on fillets of human heads, for female face.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, "Qasr", east annex (G), chamber 18
Curator's comments: For the shape compare Pl. GB 592.3-4. BMC B.128.1. BSA xlvii, 131-C 1.10. Chemical analysis found similarities with Group E. Painted by the painter of the Linman tepe-Amphora (Özer 2009, 259)
Findspot number '18' is pencilled on the item
